intro: Galium manshuricum, commonly known as the Far Eastern bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to eastern Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white or pale yellow flowers during the summer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Galium manshuricum is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
